intro: Phylloglottis, commonly known as the fern moss, is a genus of liverworts belonging to the family Pottiaceae. These small, cryptogamic plants are typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. They have a thalloid structure, which is a flat, leaf-like body without true stems or leaves. Phylloglottis species are characterized by their intricate leaf-like structures that aid in water retention and photosynthesis. They play an important role in soil stabilization and as indicators of environmental conditions in their habitats.
